intro: Naucleopsis stipularis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nauclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in suitable habitats.
